snippet: Exports surged last month, helping to produce an unexpected trade surplus of $5.35 billion in March, but imports grew lethargically, a warning sign for the nation.
abstract: China's exports surged in the last month, helping to produce an unexpected trade surplus of $5.35 billion, but imports grew at a slower pace, a warning sign for the nation; Chinese government faces a difficult balancing act as it has used strong economic growth as a means to boost its claims to political legitimacy, tempering what it can do in response to weakening of domestic demand.
lead_paragraph: Exports surged last month, helping to produce an unexpected trade surplus of $5.35 billion in March, but imports grew lethargically, a warning sign for the nation.

headline.seo: Surplus in China Trade Comes as Surprise
headline.main: Trade Gains Put China in Quandary
headline.print_headline: Trade Gains Put China In Quandary
